Klasse StackEmptyException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
java.lang.RuntimeException
StackEmptyException
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
Serializable
public class StackEmptyException extends RuntimeException
An Exception class for Stacks, which are empty (null) and cannot return anything. This class is especially for GenericStackClass and it is an unchecked Exception, because a lot of Java’s built-in collections and data structures (like ArrayList, Stack) use unchecked exceptions. Therefore it extends RuntimeException class.
Siehe auch:

    Konstruktoren
    Konstruktor
    Beschreibung
    StackEmptyException()
    A default constructure without a parameter, which has "The Stack is empty, you cant return anything!".
    StackEmptyException(String message)
    A constructure, which is for putting error or Exceptions messages out.
    StackEmptyException(String message, Throwable cause)
    A constructor that takes both a custom message and a cause for the exception.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • StackEmptyException

      public StackEmptyException(String message)
      A constructure, which is for putting error or Exceptions messages out. It has a parameter, which is the message itself
      Parameter:
      message - the message, which is the output

    • StackEmptyException

      public StackEmptyException()
      A default constructure without a parameter, which has "The Stack is empty, you cant return anything!".

    • StackEmptyException

      public StackEmptyException(String message, Throwable cause)
      A constructor that takes both a custom message and a cause for the exception. This can be used to provide more detailed error information, especially when an exception occurs due to another underlying exception.
      Parameter:
      message - the custom error message to be displayed
      cause - the underlying exception that caused this exception
